doc.previous: A measure is continuous from above If E1 E2 E3 are measurable sets and for all n En 1 En then the intersection of the sets En is measurable furthermore if at least one of the En has finite measure then
doc.after: This property is false without the assumption that at least one of the En has finite measure For instance for each n N let En n R which all have infinite Lebesgue measure but the intersection is empty
